body:
I'm trying to perform a grid based daylight simulation. The issue Is that the process get stuck at the oconv stage (see image).

I tried to follow this discussion:

[http://www.grasshopper3d.com/group/ladybug/forum/topics/honey-bee-i...](http://www.grasshopper3d.com/group/ladybug/forum/topics/honey-bee-issue)

but no use.

I'll appreciate any help on this.

Thanks,

Gal

replies.body:
Hi Gal,

What version of Radiance are you using? May i say that it is V5.0?

-A.

Hi Gal,

I realised that you´re using Dropbox folder, can you change it e.g. to desktop and try it with it ?

Or second thing is if you have milions of small geometries overlapping then Radiance can struggle there.



Best

Peter

Hi Peter,



Thank you for your reply, I tried to open the file from a different directory, unfortunately it doesn't seem to be the problem, the process gets stuck in the same place, as you can see in the new image.



Thanks,



Gal
Gal, Can you share the geometry or the radiance files?

Hi Mostapha,

Good to hear you again!!

Gal is a student of mine. She is using the attached files. For the other students they work fine. I can't get where or why it is happening.

Thanks,

-A.

Hi Abraham! Thanks :).

This file looks just fine. Can you share with me the radiance files that are generated on her machine? I want to see if it has to do something with the files.

Gal,

Please compress (zip format) the directory where all the files are created and post it here?

The solution is on the way ... :-)

-A.

Hi Mostapha,



these are the files in the working directory. Is this what you meant?



Gal

The files are fine on my end ...

Let's see what Mostapha finds ... hopefully.

-A.
It runs just fine on my machine too. Should we send this question to unmethours.com so Greg can take a look?

Hmmmm ...

Let's try/test this.

Gal: Double click the file unnamed_RADInit.bat and see if it runs fine or get stuck like when you run Honeybee?

-A.
